job_description: University faculty : SciencesDepartment : Mathematics - naXys research instituteGrade : researcherContract : fixed term contractCategory : scientific personnelAllocation : University staffResponsabilitiesResponsibilitiesThis position is funded by the project âModular Koopman-operator based representations for nonlinear network identificationâ (KORNET), a joint project between the naXys research institute at the University of Namur (PI: Alexandre Mauroy) and the ICTEAM/INMA institute at UCLouvain (PI: Julien Hendrickx). The researcher will be affiliated with the naXys research institute in Namur, but will spend 20% of his/her time at the ICTEAM/INMA institute in Louvain-la-Neuve. The goal of the Kornet project is to leverage Koopman operator theory in the context of nonlinear network identification. In particular, the selected candidate will develop a modular Koopman operator-based representation of interconnected dynamical systems, which preserves and exploits network structure.EnvironmentThe University of Namur (UNamur) is located in the center of Belgium, in the French-speaking part of the country. More info: https://www.unamur.be/en/institution/index The naXys institute brings together 25 professors and more than 50 researchers working on complex systems in a broad sense, including systems theory, network science, graph theory, control theory, statistics, optimization, and applications to celestial mechanics, cosmology, economics, and optical engineering, to list a few. He/she is expected to have a solid background in Applied Mathematics, with a keen interest in learning theoretical concepts but also in developing practical methodologies for applications. Specific knowledge of operator theory, networked dynamics, control theory, and/or system identification will be appreciated.
